title: Samples of Anonymised Records Support (2011-12 extension)
abstractText:
The project provides a programme of support for Samples of Anonymised Records (SARs) and other individual or household data files from the 1991 and 2001 Censuses under the Census Programme 2006-2011. These data include:

  • 1991 2 per cent Individual SAR - UK
  • 1991 1 per cent Household SAR - UK
  • 2001 3 per cent Individual Licensed SAR - UK
  • 2001 1 per cent Household SAR - England and Wales, under Special Licence from UK Data Archive
  • 2001 5 per cent Small Area Microdata file - UK

In addition the team at the University of Manchester is working with ONS to support more detailed files currently available only within national statistical offices.
Our programme of work will include the following components:

  • Providing access to data through a variety of media and in a variety of formats.
  • Support and a reduced level of training for users including a helpdesk service and a participation in workshops.
  • The promotion of data and provision of information through newsletters and social media.
  • Monitoring the use of SAR files and their impact.
  • Working with the Census offices to complete arrangements for 2011 microdata.
